intro: Callitriche fissa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water starwort, is a small aquatic plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, ditches, and slow-moving streams. The plant has slender, branching stems that are often submerged, with small, opposite, ovate leaves that are usually less than 1 cm in length. It produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are arranged in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Callitriche fissa is an important component of aquatic ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and amphibians.
